skill.author: Community

security_audit.summary: All 57 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES. The analyzer misidentified markdown code blocks as command execution and generic patterns as cryptographic/network threats. This is a documentation-heavy skill with basic Python CLI scaffolding scripts. No actual malicious code or dangerous operations exist.

static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: These are markdown code blocks showing bash commands like 'python scripts/security_scanner.py'. The analyzer confused markdown code fences with Ruby backtick syntax. No actual command execution code exists in these files.

static_findings_evaluation.finding: external_commands: Ruby/shell backtick execution at references/compliance_requirements.md:20,25,43 and similar in security_standards.md, vulnerability_management_guide.md
static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: These are TypeScript code examples in markdown documentation blocks using // comments. Not Ruby backticks. The analyzer incorrectly identified documentation as executable code.

static_findings_evaluation.finding: blocker: Weak cryptographic algorithm at SKILL.md:3,14 and scripts/compliance_checker.py:74, scripts/security_scanner.py:74, scripts/vulnerability_assessor.py:74
static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: No cryptographic code exists in this skill. The Python scripts only use standard library (os, sys, json, argparse, pathlib). This appears to be a pattern-matching false positive.

static_findings_evaluation.finding: filesystem: Python file write/append at scripts/compliance_checker.py:107, scripts/security_scanner.py:107, scripts/vulnerability_assessor.py:107
static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: Standard file output for JSON report generation: 'with open(args.output, w) as f: f.write(output)'. Legitimate CLI tool behavior with command-line controlled output paths.

static_findings_evaluation.finding: sensitive: Environment file access at SKILL.md:126
static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: Documentation references '.env.example' file as standard setup. This is standard project initialization documentation, not actual environment variable access or secret exposure.

static_findings_evaluation.finding: blocker: System reconnaissance at SKILL.md:83 and references files
static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: The skill is literally a security operations toolkit. References to 'security scanner', 'vulnerability assessor', and 'compliance checker' are legitimate tool descriptions, not malicious reconnaissance.

content.user_title: Automate security scanning and compliance checks
content.value_statement: Security teams spend hours manually reviewing code and configurations for vulnerabilities. This SecOps skill provides automated security scanning, vulnerability assessment, and compliance checking tools to streamline security operations and ensure consistent coverage.
actual_capabilities: Scan codebases for security vulnerabilities and misconfigurations
Assess target systems for common security weaknesses
Verify compliance against security standards and frameworks
Generate security assessment reports in JSON format
Support multiple programming languages and frameworks
Provide security best practices and anti-patterns documentation
limitations: Does not perform penetration testing or exploit validation
Does not access external APIs or live services
Relies on user-provided target paths and configurations
Scanner scripts are scaffolding templates requiring full implementation

use_cases.title: Automate security assessments
use_cases.description: Run automated security scans on codebases to identify vulnerabilities before deployment.

use_cases.title: Integrate security into CI/CD
use_cases.description: Add security scanning steps to pipelines using the provided CLI tools and templates.

use_cases.title: Verify security controls
use_cases.description: Check systems against compliance requirements and generate audit documentation.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Security Scan
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the senior-secops skill to scan my project at [path] for security vulnerabilities. Show me the findings and recommendations.

prompt_templates.title: Compliance Check
prompt_templates.prompt: Run a compliance check on [target] to verify it meets security standards. Generate a report of any gaps.

prompt_templates.title: Vulnerability Assessment
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the vulnerability assessor to analyze [target] for security weaknesses. Provide a detailed findings report.

prompt_templates.title: Security Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a complete security review using all senior-secops tools. Analyze [target], check compliance, and summarize risks.

output_examples.input: Scan my React application for security issues
output: Security scan complete for React application
- Potential XSS vulnerability in user input handling
Recommendations: Apply security headers, sanitize inputs, update dependencies

output_examples.input: Check if my API meets compliance requirements
output: Compliance check results for API endpoints
Action items: Add rate limiting middleware, implement request validation

best_practices: Run security scans early in the development cycle to catch issues before they reach production
Use the JSON output format for automated integration with CI/CD pipelines and dashboards
Review and implement the security best practices documented in the reference guides
anti_patterns: Skipping security scans due to time pressure and deploying vulnerable code to production
Ignoring low-severity findings that can accumulate into significant security debt
Using security tools only for compliance checks without acting on the findings

faq.question: What programming languages does the scanner support?
faq.answer: The skill provides guidance for TypeScript, JavaScript, Python, Go, Swift, and Kotlin codebases.

faq.question: Can I integrate this into GitHub Actions?
faq.answer: Yes. The CLI tools support JSON output that can be parsed and used in CI/CD pipeline steps.

faq.question: Does the skill perform live penetration testing?
faq.answer: No. The tools perform static analysis and compliance checks, not active exploitation or penetration testing.

faq.question: What compliance frameworks are supported?
faq.answer: The reference documentation covers general security standards. Specific framework validation requires user configuration.

faq.question: How do I customize the security rules?
faq.answer: Modify the scanner scripts and configuration to add custom rules matching your security requirements.

faq.question: Can I generate reports in formats other than JSON?
faq.answer: Currently only JSON output is supported. The output can be post-processed to other formats as needed.
